Description: Ostracon, fragment (now split into two pieces) of the body of a pale-red pottery vessel, the interior is partially covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and remains of six lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394160) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394160)
